result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathon A Rieck

State by Hynek / Def w/ Atty Betthauser
Stmt of Neg Plea filed
Def plead & sentenced in 15CF166 & 15CF345
THIS CASE IS DISMISSED BUT READ-IN

from Atty Betthauser   re: Plea/SEH was set for 9-16-15.  Atty Betthauser will be unable to appear by phone due to conflict w/ schedule & will need case cont'd to next Fel sentencing date.  Atty Betthauser has notified ADA Hynek.
Rescheduled to 9-28-15 @ 8:45

State by Hynek /  Def in custody w/ Atty Betthauser
Stmt of Neg Plea
Def plead in 15CF166 & 15CF345
THIS CASE IS TO BE DISMISSED & READ-IN
Betthauser:  I haven't considered the counterfit vs. imitation (re: 15CF166)
CRT:  I want to give you a chance to look @ that.  There's a substantial difference in potential penalties.  Not something I thought about before CRT & didn't know the plea agreement before CRT & in light of the fact you hadn't gone over specific instructions prior to today I want you to go over the distinction between counterfeit & imiation
Def:  Can I still go forward w/ plea?
CRT:  it's an important distinction
Betthauser:  def wants to go forward today
CRT comments further...it hasn't been discussed w/ def & at first glance it's not particularly clear.  I hear from ADA that she hadn't weighed the distinction between counterfeit & imitation - in light of the potential penalties it's important that this issue be clarified before the plea is taken
Betthauser addresses bond
Hynek: part of me who understands his position wouldn't object but I have concerns about def coming back to CRT as we've had problems in the past
CRT:  I could sentence def on the Misd charge (Ct 4 in 15CF345) & then address bond
CRT finds def Guilty of Ct 4 ONLY in 15CF345
Plea/SEH on Felony Charges is 9-16-15 @ 10:30
CRT orders $5000 Signature Bond w/ same conditions & add that def abide by the conditions of probation in 15CF345
Motion for Consolidation w/ cses 15CF345, 15CF166 & 15CM264 - Order consolidating cases in Br 4 signed by SLH
Status conference at 09-02-2015 10:00 am
Charles Betthauser
Risk Assessment
